meanings.definition: a hard, fine-grained sedimentary rock containing iron oxide
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a piece of ironstone during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The ironstone in the quarry was perfect for building sturdy walls.
meanings.sent3: When the ironstone rolled down the hill, it sounded like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The ironstone cliffs stood tall and proud against the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The ironstone's deep red color made it stand out among the other rocks.

meanings.definition: a type of pottery or china made from a type of clay that contains iron ore
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed beautiful ironstone plates from the 1800s.
meanings.sent2: The ironstone teapot was a cherished family heirloom.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter dropped the ironstone bowl, causing a loud clatter.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of ironstone dishes gleamed under the kitchen lights.
meanings.sent5: The ironstone mug kept her coffee warm for hours.

meanings.definition: a type of iron-rich mineral or rock commonly used in construction and industry
meanings.sent1: The construction crew used ironstone to reinforce the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent2: The ironstone quarry supplied materials for the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The ironstone block was so heavy that it took four workers to lift it.
meanings.sent4: The ironstone deposits in the mine were essential for the steel industry.
meanings.sent5: The ironstone wall withstood the test of time and weather.
